Item ID1982

A tomato is food that is mainly used as an ingredient in other foods such as garden pies and all types of pizzas. It can also be consumed to heal 2 Hitpoints.

Five tomatoes can be stored in a basket. One basket of tomatoes is required to pay a gardener to watch over growing yanillian hops or a growing oak tree, and three baskets of tomatoes are required to pay a gardener to watch over a growing cadava berry bush.

Some tomatoes can be put into a Compost Bin to make compost. However, a full bin of tomatoes produces a bin of rotten tomatoes instead.

Additional sources[edit | edit source]

  • Members can grow tomatoes by planting three tomato seeds in an allotment patch at level 12 Farming. They can plant a marigold seed in the flower patch to prevent the tomatoes from becoming diseased, or pay the gardener two sacks of cabbages to ensure they grow.
  • Players can also acquire tomatoes by talking to the Recruiter in West Ardougne; the nearby men will throw tomatoes at him, and players can pick these up from the ground. However, this is a very slow method for obtaining tomatoes, and other methods except waiting for spawns are greatly preferred.

[[File:Tomato detail.png|left|110px]]
A '''tomato''' is [[food]] that is mainly used as an ingredient in other foods such as [[garden pie]]s and all types of [[pizza]]s. It can also be consumed to heal 2 [[Hitpoints]].

Five tomatoes can be stored in a [[basket]]. One [[basket of tomatoes]] is required to pay a gardener to watch over growing [[yanillian hops]] or a growing [[Oak (Farming)|oak]] tree, and three baskets of tomatoes are required to pay a gardener to watch over a growing [[Cadava berries|cadava berry]] bush.

Some tomatoes can be put into a [[Compost Bin]] to make [[compost]]. However, a full bin of tomatoes produces a bin of [[rotten tomato]]es instead.

===Shop locations===
{{Store locations list|Tomato}}

===Additional sources===
*Members can grow tomatoes by planting three [[tomato seed]]s in an [[allotment]] patch at level 12 [[Farming]]. They can plant a [[marigold seed]] in the flower patch to prevent the tomatoes from becoming [[Disease (Farming)|diseased]], or pay the gardener two sacks of [[cabbage]]s to ensure they grow.
*Players can also acquire tomatoes by talking to the [[Recruiter]] in [[West Ardougne]]; the nearby men will throw tomatoes at him, and players can pick these up from the ground. However, this is a very slow method for obtaining tomatoes, and other methods except waiting for spawns are greatly preferred.
